title: Karnataka withdraws pre-show cause IGST notice to Infosys
description: The IT services giant received the notices on July 31, pertaining to services it received from its overseas branches in various foreign countries. The Salil Parekh-led company has maintained that it is fully compliant with state and central legislations in this matter.
content: The Karnataka government has withdrawn the Rs 32,000 crore tax notice to Infosys, but the story that has sparked a hue and cry is far from over.A day after Infosys acknowledged the receipt of a notice for alleged evasion of over Rs 32,000 crore ($3.8 billion) in integrated goods and services tax (IGST), the IT major in a late evening exchange filing on Thursday said, “The Company has received a communication from Karnataka State authorities, withdrawing the pre-show cause notice and has directed the Company to submit further response to DGGI central authority on this matter.”Sources however said that the probe against the company will now be carried by the Directorate General of GST (DGGI).“If the company is probed both by the state and the central GST (in this case the DGGI) departments, an issue of double jeopardy could be raised by the company while contesting the notices and hence the state body has withdrawn its case, the case however will be decided by the DGGI which has also issued a pre-show cause notice asking the company why a demand notice for a little over Rs.32,000 crore shouldn’t be made,” said a senior official.
